a dog: [adjective] Being everywhere at once: omnipresent. (e.g. To Hindus, Jews, Christians, and Muslims, God is ubiquitous.) ; [adjective] Appearing to be everywhere at once; being or seeming to be in more than one location at the same time. ; [adjective] Widespread; very prevalent.

[adjective] Being everywhere at once: omnipresent. (e.g. To Hindus, Jews, Christians, and Muslims, God is ubiquitous.) ; [adjective] Appearing to be everywhere at once; being or seeming to be in more than one location at the same time. ; [adjective] Widespread; very prevalent.

[noun] A challenge to prove courage. ; [noun] The quality of daring; venturesomeness; boldness. ; [noun] Defiance; challenge. ; [verb] To have enough courage (to do something). (e.g. I wouldn't dare argue with my boss.) ; [verb] To defy or challenge (someone to do something) (e.g. I dare you (to) kiss that girl.) ; [verb] To have enough courage to meet or do something, go somewhere, etc.; to face up to (e.g. Will you dare death to reach your goal?) ; [verb] To terrify; to daunt. ; [verb] To catch (larks) by producing terror through the use of mirrors, scarlet cloth, a hawk, etc., so that they lie still till a net is thrown over them.
